meanings.definition: A unit of volume equal to 100 liters.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for two hectoliters of water to make the soup.
meanings.sent2: The farmer stored the milk in hectoliters to keep track of the quantity.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled a hectoliters of oil while cooking, creating a slippery mess.
meanings.sent4: The lake seemed to hold a hectoliters of tears, reflecting the sorrow of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of a hectoliters of rain hitting the roof was soothing to the ears.

meanings.definition: A quantity of liquid measure equal to 100 liters.
meanings.sent1: The brewery produced several hectoliters of beer for the festival.
meanings.sent2: The shipping company transported hectoliters of oil across the country.
meanings.sent3: The children had a hectoliters of fun playing in the water park.
meanings.sent4: The fountain in the square seemed to spout hectoliters of sparkling water.
meanings.sent5: The garden needed a hectoliters of water to flourish under the summer sun.
